double - cost cost associated with transversing vertex in any direction
Method Detail

getColor


public String getColor()
Gets the color of a vertex

Returns:
String vertex color. The colors used by Dijktra's algorithm are "white", "gray", and "black"

getCost


public double getCost()
Returns the cost associated with the vertex

Returns:
double cost

getDistance


public double getDistance(MyVertex w)
Calculates the Euclidian (straight-line) distance between two vertices in number of pixels

Parameters:
MyVertex - the vertex from which distance is computed
Returns:
double distance: the number of pixels separating the two vertices

getI


public int getI()
Returns the row position of a vertex in the vertex array

Returns:
int vertex row

getJ


public int getJ()
Returns the column position of a vertex in the vertex array

Returns:
int vertex column

getNeighbors


public HashSet getNeighbors(double neighborhood,

                            MyVertex[][] vertexArray,

                            boolean probabilistic)
Returns a HashSet with this vertice's neighbors. Pixels with negative value are excluded.

Parameters:
double - neighborhood: the threshold distance below which vertices are considered neighbors. In number of pixels. The maximum neighborhood is set by the vertexArray dimensions
MyVertex[][] - vertexArray: the array from which neighbors are drawn
boolean - probabilistic: if true, a random subset of neighbors is returned neighbors with lower cost are more likely to be returned; if false, all neighbors are returned
Returns:
HashSet the vertice's neighbors

isSource


public boolean isSource()
Checks whether a vertex is a source

Returns:
boolean is the vertex a source?

public boolean isTarget()
Checks whether a vertex is a target

boolean is the vertex a target?

setColor


public void setColor(String color)
Labels the vertex to represent whether it has been visited in Dijktra's algorithm

Parameters:
String - vertex color: "white", "gray", or "black"

setCost


public void setCost(int cost)
Stores vertex cost

Parameters:
int - cost: the relative cost to cross a vertex in any direction
